paragraph:
[SECTOR_7G] // URBAN_FLORA
LEVEL: PERSISTENT

We have been monitoring the crack in the sidewalk outside the main entrance for 412 days. What was initially recorded as a structural failure has evolved into a sophisticated biological rebellion. A dandelion (Taraxacum officinale) has bypassed our industrial-grade concrete barriers.

[ IMAGE_ID: REBEL_FLORA_01 ]

SENSORY LOG:

This organism does not care about your urban planning. It draws nutrients from discarded cigarette filters and rainwater flavored with diesel exhaust. It is not just growing; it is calculating the most efficient way to turn this street back into a meadow.

The resilience of these "weeds" suggests they are the original hackers of the physical world. They find a 1mm vulnerability in a billion-dollar infrastructure and exploit it to launch a green process that cannot be killed by any Task Manager.

PH_LEVEL: 4.2 (ACIDIC)GROWTH_RATE: 0.2MM/DAYWILL_TO_SURVIVE: 100%

FINAL VERDICT: If humans ever leave this city for a long weekend, these plants will have already re-written the city's source code. We are not the admins here; we are just temporary guests with leaf blowers.

*Internal Note: Stop calling them weeds. They are clearly the local server administrators.
